quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Team and Cowboys
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, heisman. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Cowboys had the first selection in the 1974 draft. Who did they take?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Too Tall  Jones

questions.question: In what year did Roger Staubach win the Heisman Trophy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1963

questions.question: How many innings are in a Little League baseball game, excluding extra innings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: For what team did Tony Dorsett play after he left the Cowboys?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denver Broncos

questions.question: How many games are in a Major League Baseball season per team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 162

questions.question: Has wrestler Bret Hart been inducted in the WWE Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Troy Aikman graduated from UCLA, but where did he begin his college career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oklahoma

questions.question: In professional wrestling, the high side thrust kick, often used by Shawn Michaels as a finishing move, is also known by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweet Chin Music

questions.question: What number did Hank Aaron wear for the Atlanta Braves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 44

questions.question: In Major League Baseball, first and second bases are this far apart.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 90

questions.question: Which of these people founded the World Wrestling Entertainment, Inc?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vincent McMahon

questions.question: RAW wrestling star Kurt Angle was shaved on stage after a match with Edge in 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This team moved to Detroit in 1957. It was founded by Fred Zollner in 1940.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pistons

questions.question: Professional wrestler Ric Flair was once manager of the WWEs RAW brand.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many home runs did Hank Aaron hit in his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 755

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Player and Detroit Pistons
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, suns, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This European player was drafted in 2001 by the San Antonio Spurs. He became the youngest player ever to appear in a game with the Spurs making his NBA debut at 19 years old.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Parker

questions.question: The Cowboys were originally called the Dallas Texans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: He was drafted in 2002 by Phoenix Suns, right after Nikoloz Tskitishvili , Dajuan Wagner, Nene, and Chris Wilcox.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amare Stoudemire

questions.question: Rashard Lewis was the 3rd pick in 1998.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 1986 Detroit Pistons had great luck- they made two good draft picks. One of them was John Salley and the other was the 27th selected player.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Rodman

questions.question: He was selected by the Phoenix Suns in the first round (15th pick overall) of the 1996 NBA Draft.  In 2005 he was awarded MVP (most valuable player).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Nash

questions.question: Which of these players won the Super Bowl MVP despite his teams loss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Howley

questions.question: This player was drafted in 1962 by the Celtics. He is also known as Hondo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonh Havlicek

questions.question: Which of these Cowboys won the Super Bowl XII MVP trophy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harvey Martin

questions.question: Although this player was the 36th selected player drafted by the Philadelphia 76ers in 1978, he turned out to be the best point guard drafted that year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maurice Cheeks

questions.question: Before they were the L.A. Lakers, they played in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minneapolis

questions.question: This player was the 31st selected in 2001 draft by the Golden State Warriors.  He and Jamison was chossen to represent the Washington Wizards at the 2005 NBA All-Star Game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gilbert Arenas

questions.question: Chicago Bulls drafted this player in 1984, who is probably the best in the NBA ever. He played his final game on April 16, 2003.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Jordan

questions.question: Although he wasnt the best player on his college team, he became an All-Star player in his fifth season. Detroit Pistons drafted him in 1971.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Curtis Rowe

questions.question: Before they were the Detroit Pistons, the Pistons played in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ft. Wayne, Indiana

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Team and Football
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, atlanta, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the original home to the NFL Rams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleveland, OH

questions.question: These are the only two original NBA teams that never  moved.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knicks and Celtics

questions.question: Where were the NBA Hawks located, before moving to Atlanta?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Louis,MO

questions.question: To which city do the Sacramento Kings trace their origins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rochester, NY

questions.question: Where were the Dodgers playing before they moved to L.A.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooklyn, NY

questions.question: This team, nicknamed The Hurricanes, won three NCAA Football Titles in the 1980s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miami

questions.question: According to Dickinson poll, in 1928 this football team, coached by Howard Jones, won its first national title.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USC

questions.question: This team won the 2005 NCAA Football Championship, lead by head coach Mack Brown
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas

questions.question: Where did the Philadelphia Eagles use to play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pittsburgh and Philadelphia

questions.question: This team, with head coach Tom Osborne, won the most NCAA football Championships in the 1990s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nebraska

questions.question: Where did the San Francisco Giants play before San Francisco?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York, NY

questions.question: This team won the 1994 NCAA Division I-A national football championship. The motto of the team is: Not the victory but the action. Not the goal but the game. In the deed the glory.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nebraska

questions.question: In 1958, this team shared their first title from NCAA Division I-A national football championship with Iowa.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: LSU

questions.question: In 1927 this Ivy League team won the NCAA Division I-A national football championship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yale

questions.question: Where did the Atlanta Braves team originate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nickname and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, john, carolina. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In the 1967 NFL Championship Game Green Bay beat Dallas 21-17. Which nickname is attached to this game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ice Bowl

questions.question: Which American university has chosen the spider as its official mascot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Richmond

questions.question: Which of these teams won their first Super Bowl in 2005?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What is the nickname of the University of Tennessees teams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Volunteers

questions.question: The Boilermakers is the nickname of which American university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Purdue University

questions.question: Which team won the 1940 National Football League Championship Game with 73-0?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Bears

questions.question: Which championship game was called The Greatest Game Ever Played and was the first  championship game to go into overtime?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The 1958 Championship Game

questions.question: Which is the nickname of North Carolina and of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tar Heels

questions.question: This team, led by head coach James Tressel,  won the 2002 NCAA championship, beating Miami in overtime.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ohio State

questions.question: The nickname for the University of Washington is the Huskies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what year did Notre Dame and their head coach Knute Rockne, win their first NCAA football Championship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1924

questions.question: The Eagles athletic teams represent which college/university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston College

questions.question: The athletic teams of St. John’s University were called the Redmen in the 1920s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In 1933 this team won the first NFL Championship Game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Bears

questions.question: Which NFL team won their 12th Championship in 1997?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Bay Packers

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Summerslam and Title
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, title, players. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bret Hart wrestled in every SummerSlam that he could, while a WWF SuperStar.  From 1988-1997 he missed only one SummerSlam.  What year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1996

questions.question: The Largest in terms of attendance SummerSlam took Place in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1992

questions.question: Hulk Hogan has won a title at SummerSlam.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Honky Tonk man lost the Intercontinental Title to Ultimate Warrior at the first SummerSlam in 1988, but who was Honky originally to defend his title against?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brutus Beefcake

questions.question: Which team won Super Bowl VII and Super Bowl VIII?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miami Dolphins

questions.question: How Many Times has Randy Savage been the Macho King at SummerSlam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: In the SmackDown! US title match from the 2003 edition of SummerSlam, who walked out the US Champion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eddie Guerrero

questions.question: Which of these teams was defeated at the Super Bowl XXXIII game by the Denver Broncos?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlanta Falcons

questions.question: The first steel cage match at SummerSlam was between which two competitors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ultimate Warrior/Rick Rude

questions.question: What NFL team did O.J. Simpson play for at the end of his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Francisco 49ers

questions.question: Which team won five NBA titles in the 1980s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles Lakers

questions.question: The Ultimate Warrior and Rick Rude competed for the Intercontinental Title in which SummerSlam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1989

questions.question: This player from Alabama University was the Championship MVP in 1968.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bart Starr

questions.question: Which of these players have never won the Super Bowl MVP?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan Marino

questions.question: How many times has SummerSlam been in New York City, at Madison Square Garden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At least 3

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Number and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, college, outfielder. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What number did Major League Baseball player Pete Rose wear when he played for the Cincinnati Reds?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florida Sate

questions.question: What number did American football quarterback Joe Montana wear when he played for the college team Notre Dame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: What number did Kirby Puckett,  who was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame in 2001, wear when he was a player for the Minnesota Twins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 34

questions.question: What number did baseball player Darryl Strawberry wear when he played for the Los Angeles Dodgers in the 1990s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 44

questions.question: What number did Carlton Fisk, who was inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 2000, wear when he played for the Chicago White Sox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 72

questions.question: What number did Tom Seaver, who was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame on January in 1992,  wear when he was a player for the New York Mets in the 1970s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 41

questions.question: What number did Don Mattingly wear when he played as a part-time first baseman and outfielder for the New York Yankees in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 46

questions.question: What NBA team is known for their cowbells?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sacramento Kings

questions.question: What number did O. J. Simpson, a member of the Pro Football Hall of Fame, wear when he played for the Buffalo Bills in the 70s?

questions.question: What number did  Baseball Hall of Famer, Rod Carew, wear on his uniform when he played for the Minnesota Twins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 29

questions.question: What NBA team did Bill Walton lead to a NBA title?

questions.question: What college basketball team did Billy King, general manager of the Philadelphia 76ers, play for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duke
